result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery James Campbell

defendant.name: Campbell, Jeffery James
defendant.address: c/o DHS, 630 Sanborn Avenue, Ashland, WI 54806

records.addlTxt: 10:28 AM Defendant Jeffery James Campbell in court.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III in court for Jeffery James Campbell.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22cm24, 20CM116, 22CF82, 21CM91, and 22CM73.  Parties have an agreement.  Atty def admits he is a repeater.  Def agrees.  Def understands charges and range of potential penalties.  Atty def pleads NO CONTEST, def agrees.  Files contain PLQ, understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaints, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists, finds def guilty and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  See attached for sentencing.
Offer to Settle

2:10 PM Defendant Jeffery James Campbell appeared by video from conference room in court house.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Jeffery James Campbell.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF82, 22CM73, 20CM116, 20CM91, and 22CM24.  All cases here for a STC. . Atty, parties have reached an agreement, joint recommendation.  Def needs to appear in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.

1:07 PM Defendant Jeffery James Campbell appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.   Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF82, 22CM73, 20CM116, 21CM91, and 22CM24.  Warrants quashed in all cases.  State comments on bail/bond, bond in case continue.  Def must appear in person for all cases.  Atty Heidi Brewer special appearance, comments on bail/bond.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:33 PM Defendant Jeffery James Campbell in court by telephone.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Jeffery James Campbell.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF82, 22CM73, 20CM116, 21CM91, and 22CM24.  Atty states def phone number is in hearing, sent message to def, did receive a test from him within the last 10 mins.  Back on the record at 2:42.  Atty is not able to get in contact with def.  Court there was a number in the zoom, number that was there disconnected and did not reconnect.  21CM116, def has FTA five or six times on $1000 cash bail now.  Warrant authorized, BOW, Needs to appear in person for the remainder of these cases.
Arraignment on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:11 AM - 22 CF 82, 22 CM 73, 20 CM 116, 21 CM 91, 22 CM 24 - Prosecuting attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery James Campbell appeared by phone.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Jeffery James Campbell. 9:38 am - Bk on record.  22 CF 82, 22 CM 73, 22 CM 24 - here for INIT - Rec'd copy compl's, waives read.  22 CM 24 & 22 CM 73 - Plea N/G.  22 CF 82 - WOPH, given rt to PH.  Ct finds PC def com fel in Ashland Co, bound over.  Info filed w/same chgs as in compl....req ARGN at future dte by Atty.  ARGN - 9/12 at 2 pm....other cases STC on same dte/time.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:27 PM Attorney Thomas Locante appeared by video for Jeffery James Campbell.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery James Campbell appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Cases 22CF82, 22CM73, 20CM116, 21CM91, 22CM24.   SPD office looking for attorney to cover all the cases.  Conflict case 22CM73.  Represents all other cases.  Attorney makes sense to continue to wait and resolve all cases together, will do as court directs.  State waiting a brief period of time is fine.  If not attorney at next STC will start to proceed and think about appointing an attorney.  AIA in all cases.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:31 PM Defendant Jeffery James Campbell in court with attorney Thomas Locante.  Defendant Jeffery James Campbell in custody in ACJ.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffery James Campbell appeared by video means with Attorney. 22CF82,22CM73,22CM24,21CM91,20CM16--  22CM73 and 22CF82 INIT---   Atty comments 22cm73-- determined by the office, they will need to look for private counsel, so atty has not been apt'd. Atty comments- will look for private counsel for all the cases, so the cases all have one atty. Ct comments- PD has a hard time on finding atty's. If the SPD can find an atty for all the cases the Ct will let the tty withdraw, but until then the atty will stay on. Ct will adj all the cases. 
if the def is not in custody he needs to appr in person  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:03 AM Defendant Jeffery James Campbell appeared by video means from ACJ. Attorney David Meany appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Thomas Locante appears by video for Atty for def.  Cases 22CM73, 20CM116, 21CM91, 22CM24. and 22CF82.  Atty has not recv'd compliant on 2 newest cases.  State 22CF82 uncharged case that was included in bail hearing on 5/31/22.  22CM73 bail not set but asking to have included.  Court makes bond cover all cases 22CF82, 22CM24 21CM91 20CM116 22CM73.  $1000 cash with non-monetary conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
